sourcing.instructions: Cs: Purchase from a chemical supply company; Rb: Obtain from specialty chemical suppliers; Sb: Available from metal suppliers; Sn: Purchase from electronics or metal supply stores.
steps: Cs: Purchase from a chemical supply company; Rb: Obtain from specialty chemical suppliers; Sb: Available from metal suppliers; Sn: Purchase from electronics or metal supply stores.

1. Measure 11.6 g of Cs using an analytical balance. 2. Measure 5.5 g of Rb. 3. Measure 21.2 g of Sb. 4. Measure 4.5 g of Sn. 5. Combine all materials in a clean, dry mixing container. 6. Use a mortar and pestle to grind the mixture until it is homogenous.
preparation.raw_text: 1. Measure 11.6 g of Cs using an analytical balance. 2. Measure 5.5 g of Rb. 3. Measure 21.2 g of Sb. 4. Measure 4.5 g of Sn. 5. Combine all materials in a clean, dry mixing container. 6. Use a mortar and pestle to grind the mixture until it is homogenous.

steps: 1. Transfer the mixture into a ceramic crucible. 2. Place the crucible in a furnace. 3. Heat to a temperature of 900 째C at a rate of 10 째C/min. 4. Maintain this temperature for 4 hours to ensure complete reaction.
heating.raw_text: 1. Transfer the mixture into a ceramic crucible. 2. Place the crucible in a furnace. 3. Heat to a temperature of 900 째C at a rate of 10 째C/min. 4. Maintain this temperature for 4 hours to ensure complete reaction.

steps: 1. Turn off the furnace. 2. Allow the crucible to cool inside the furnace to room temperature (approximately 8 hours). 3. Once cooled, carefully remove the crucible from the furnace.
cooling.raw_text: 1. Turn off the furnace. 2. Allow the crucible to cool inside the furnace to room temperature (approximately 8 hours). 3. Once cooled, carefully remove the crucible from the furnace.

steps: 1. Remove the solidified material from the crucible. 2. Use a diamond saw to cut the sample into the desired dimensions (3 inches x 2 inches x 7 inches). 3. Sand the edges with fine-grit sandpaper for a smooth finish. 4. Optionally, seal the surface with a protective coating to enhance durability.
post_processing.raw_text: 1. Remove the solidified material from the crucible. 2. Use a diamond saw to cut the sample into the desired dimensions (3 inches x 2 inches x 7 inches). 3. Sand the edges with fine-grit sandpaper for a smooth finish. 4. Optionally, seal the surface with a protective coating to enhance durability.
